meanings.definition: The quality of being harmful or destructive.
meanings.sent1: The perniciousness of the poison led to the unfortunate outcome.
meanings.sent2: The perniciousness of the storm caused widespread damage to the crops.
meanings.sent3: The perniciousness of the mischievous squirrel resulted in chaos in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The perniciousness of rumors can spread like wildfire in a small town.
meanings.sent5: The perniciousness of the virus was evident in how quickly it spread among the population.

meanings.definition: The state of causing great harm or damage.
meanings.sent1: She was shocked by the perniciousness of the vandalism in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The perniciousness of the fire left the building in ruins.
meanings.sent3: The perniciousness of the prank was unexpected but caused laughter among friends.
meanings.sent4: The perniciousness of neglect can slowly deteriorate relationships over time.
meanings.sent5: The perniciousness of the floodwaters was evident in the destruction left behind.

meanings.definition: The tendency to cause harm or injury.
meanings.sent1: The doctor warned about the perniciousness of smoking on one's health.
meanings.sent2: The perniciousness of the slippery floor led to multiple accidents.
meanings.sent3: The perniciousness of the playful puppy resulted in torn cushions but lots of joy.
meanings.sent4: The perniciousness of procrastination can hinder one's progress in life.
meanings.sent5: The perniciousness of negative thoughts can impact one's mental well-being significantly.
